titleStmt.title: J. B. Beeler et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG3024

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p:
To B Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

It is asserted and believed that a body of armed men have it in contemplation to March through a portion of the state, to make an attack upon troops encamped by authority of the United States at Cairo, in the State of Illinois. Whether this be absolutely certain or not, we are not able to say. Cosidering passing events, and the feeling between the North and the South, this seems likely to occur. Therefore, in view of of this probability, and the terrible consequences that Might flow from such an act, we earnestly request your. Excellency to issue a proclamation forbidding the passage of such armed bodies of citizens over the soil of Kentucky.

New Haven Ky May 4, 1861
J B. Beeler
Jno. N. Gano
H Beeler
C. S. Miller
Thos. H, Miller
A Chambers
T W Ganlin
B F Wilson
John A Humphrey
B. T. Atherton

109. Votes Cast at 12 oclock --
Union feeling Strong
